Name: Creating training on trauma-informed care for persons serving refugees, asylees, and migrants.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating training on trauma-informed care for persons serving refugees, asylees, and migrants

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health

Summary: This bill would require the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene to develop a training on trauma informed care, determine who, of those serving refugees, asylees and migrants, should be offered the training, and offer it to them.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      
      
      Section 1. Chapter 1 of title 17 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 17-180.2 to read as follows: 
      � 17-180.2 Trauma-informed care. a. Definitions. Provider. The term "provider" means a community-based organization or not-for-profit organization under contract or similar agreement with the department.
      Eligible participant. The term "eligible participant" means a person serving refugees, asylees, and migrants.
      Trauma-informed care. The term "trauma-informed care" means trauma-informed care as described by the substance abuse and mental health services administration of the United States department of health and human services, or any successor agency, department, or governmental entity. 
      b. Training. The department or provider, in consultation with the New York city health and hospitals corporation, shall develop training on trauma-informed care. The training shall include but not be limited to recognizing signs of trauma exposure, understanding common behaviors of people exposed to trauma, trauma-informed principles for interacting with those individuals, and resources on addressing secondary trauma. Such training shall be consistent with standards developed by the substance abuse and mental health services administration of the United States department of health and human services.
      c. Outreach. The department shall identify where the training on trauma-informed care developed pursuant to subdivision b of this section would be appropriate for eligible participants and offer training to any such persons.
      d. Reporting. Not later than 3 months after the effective date of the local law that added this section and annually thereafter, the department shall publish on its website a report on the following:
      1. The components of the training on trauma-informed care developed pursuant to subdivision b of this section;
      2. The entities to whom the training on trauma-informed care was offered; and
      3. The entities who accepted and completed the training on trauma-informed care.
      � 2. This local law takes effect 120 days after it becomes law.
